flawed_nl_solution:
Tim has 152 photos - 100 photos = <<152-100=52>>52 photos.
When Tim has 52 photos, then Paul has 52 + 10 photos = <<52+10=60>>60 photos.
Tim and Paul have together 52 photos + 60 photos = <<52+60=112>>112 photos.
That leaves Tom with 152 photos - 112 photos = <<152-112=40>>40 photos.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 62, not 60. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
